Questions.Question: These are the THREE Stooges.
These are the FOUR faces on Mount Rushmore.
Questions.Answer: George Washington, Thomas Jefferson, Abraham Lincoln, Theodore Roosevelt

Questions.Question: These are the FIVE Great Lakes.
In engineering, these SIX simple machines are the basis of all machinery.
Questions.Answer: Lever, pulley, wheel and axle, inclined plane, wedge, screw.

Questions.Question: These SEVEN titular characters appear alongside Snow White. List them.
Questions.Answer: Grumpy, Happy, Sleepy, Bashful, Sneezy, Dopey, Doc.

Questions.Question: This historical weapon would be used to hurl large stones.
This aptly-named word describes a ten-event competition.
On a break from work or school, a person might decide to go on one of these.
This part of a sentence contains the action performed by the subject.
This is the more medical term for chewing.
K then, this element is the reason bananas are slightly radioactive.
This is element number 9.
This attractive element has the symbol Fe.
This is the total number of elements on the periodic table.
Surprisingly, this element is NOT the most abundant in Earth's atmosphere, but IS the most abundant in Earth's crust.
Welcome to...now leaving! This tiny state has the smallest land area.
Nobody's home! This state has the smallest population.
Outta Time! This is the only state that chooses not to observe Daylight Savings Time.
Sorry, beachgoers! This is the only triple-landlocked state, meaning you can't get to an ocean without passing through three states!
Hello over there! This is the closest state to Africa.
This company has the largest net worth in the world.
This is the smallest country by both area and population
Represented by a single dot in Morse code, this letter is the most used in the English language.
This planet is the lightest, weighing only 0.055 times as much as Earth!
This is the city with the largest population in the world.
Out of this world! List the EIGHT planets in order!
Questions.Answer: Mercury, Venus, Earth, Mars, Jupiter, Saturn, Uranus, Neptune.

Questions.Question: Watch out, Grandma! These NINE reindeer pull Santa's sleigh.
Questions.Answer: Dasher, Dancer, Prancer, Vixen, Comet, Cupid, Donner, Blitzen, Rudolph.

Questions.Question: These TEN events make up the Decathlon.
Questions.Answer: 100m dash, long jump, shot put, high jump, 400m dash, 110m hurdles, discus, pole vault, javelin, 1500m run.

Questions.Question: These ELEVEN states seceded from the Union during the Civil War.
Questions.Answer: South Carolina, Mississippi, Florida, Alabama, Georgia, Louisiana, Texas, Virginia, Arkansas, North Carolina, Tennessee.

Questions.Question: These TWELVE Greek gods were the main Olympians.
Questions.Answer: Zeus, Hera, Poseidon, Demeter, Athena, Apollo, Artemis, Ares, Aphrodite, Hephaestus, Hermes, Dionysus.
